Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle

Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2012020175.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the south arm of the Fraser River off No. 4 and Garden City Road.

Teeth: Visible Missing, No dental work done; all molars missing

Socks: Wool, Grey, work type wool socks

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , lion with wings

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018070577.CaseDesc: On January 15, 2018, at approximately 6:00pm, Albert Ramponi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White
Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large

Case reference: 2019035278.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1982, the remains of a male were found on the banks of Bouchard Island, near Saint-Sulpice, Quebec.

Coat: Leather, Black, Three-quarters with fur collar

Case reference: 2014004201.CaseDesc: Rodney Hicks was last seen at his residence at 1700hrs on March 3, 1989. Mr. Hicks has an intellectual disability. He suffered from epilepsy and autism.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2019025073.CaseDesc: On May 10, 2019, Charles Butler-Grace was seen for the last time, with several pieces of luggage and a guitar case, in a parking lot of a Walmart in the west side of Naicam, Saskatoon. It is believed that Charles may have hitchhiked from Naicam to Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. There is also a possibility that he may have ended up in the United States.

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2014006767.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2014, Guo Ding was seen for the last time when he was discharged from the Mount Sinai Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016066830.CaseDesc:
On June 13, 1967, the remains of a male were discovered in the Detroit River at the Canada Steamship Dock, at the foot of Prospect Street. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
He is thought to have been dead for several months.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown with a few grey hairs

Shirt: Dark Blue, Dark blue sport shirt, size 15-15 1/2, Made in Canada
Sweater: Brown, Cardigan sweater labeled "Knit to Fit";
Suit: Dark Blue, Double-breasted suit with a faint dark stripe
Boots: Black, Hiking-type boots, size nine, "Pathfinder" brand

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000059.CaseDesc: Normand Pellerin was last seen on July 4, 1999, at a fireworks show in the vicinity of the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2014003608.CaseDesc: Brianne Wolgram was last seen on the evening of September 5, 1998, in Revelstoke, British Columbia.  Ms. Wolgram had plans to socialize with friends that evening but did not attend.  Ms. Wolgram's vehicle was located on September 10, 1998 on the Alkolkolex Forest Service Road near Revelstoke.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011650.CaseDesc: On June 15, 2000, the Coast Guard noticed the body of a male floating in the waters of the Saint Lawrence River near the Port of Montreal wharf.

Teeth: Other, Sup. maxillary- dental prosthesis. Inf. maxillary- no teeth

Jewelry: Brown, Wooden cross pendant with leather cord.
Socks: Green, Grey, Green top with grey foot
Boots: Brown, Isolated 120, plus protector, with laces
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-shirt, written "BEAT MOLSON DRY" "BEAT STAFF MOLSON DRY"
Coat: Nylon, Black, Synthetic lining, imitation sheep. Hooded, size medium

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim
Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004062.CaseDesc: Steve Langlois left the Gascon's dock at Port Daniel on April 27, 1996 on a lobster fishing boat. The boat was then hit by a wave and capsized. Mr. Langlois has not been found.

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on August 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring

Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2021018831.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2021, Noelle O’Soup was seen for the last time in Coquitlam, British Columbia. Noelle is known to frequent the Downtown Eastside District in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Sweater: Black, Yellow, black or yellow hooded sweater

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Mr. Bennett never arrived at Matheson Island. Mr. Bennett is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006000299.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1989, an unidentified man collapsed on the sidewalk on Yonge Street, south of Front Street in Toronto, Ontario. The man was taken to St. Michael's Hospital, where he did not regain consciousness and subsequently died.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Dark, bushy eyebrows, several days growth of a beard

Scar: Evidence of previous brain surgery (right-sided craniotomy).

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2016065648.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1968, skeletal remains were located at the base of a 50 foot cliff on the bank of the lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls. A pair of boots was located with the remains.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm , "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2019049184.CaseDesc: On September 6, 1973, the body of a well nourished man were found on East Hastings in Vancouver, British Columbia. He recently had cranial surgery due to a head injury and had several old scars on his scalp.  He had extensive scar tissue around his lungs, possibly due to smoking (emphysema) or multiple infections such as pneumonia or tuberculosis.

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014004895.CaseDesc: Desmond Peter's grandmother saw him for the last time on March 6, 2007, she reported him missing a few days later. Desmond was not happy with his home life and would often leave the house for days, but he would always return.  During the first year of his disappearance there were several unconfirmed sightings of Desmond, however none of them were considered reliable enough to confirm his whereabouts.  All tips and information brought to the investigators continues to be followed up on.

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018026641.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1991, the body of an adult Asian male was found in the Burrard Inlet, British Columbia. He was slim and healthy, with no tattoos and his teeth were in good condition. It is believed he was deceased for only one or two days prior to his body being recovered.

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2016061152.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1990, a male was found in the Detroit River, in LaSalle. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for approximately two months.

Socks: White, blue and red horizontal rings at top
Suit: Wool, Maroon, two-piece jogging suit with no pockets

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2006029199.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2006, a female was found in a field near the South Service Road and Holt Road near the Darlington Nuclear Plant in Bowmanville, Ontario. She may have been anemic, but a doctor may or may not have diagnosed this condition. Near the body there was a ring, size 9.5, that has a red garnet in the middle with a diamond on either side. The ring is stamped "Burns" on the inside and is believed to have been sold through Burns Jeweler in Oshawa, Ontario. A heart, a ribbon and a multi coloured "Blue Rodeo" brand t-shirt with a hood were also found in the vicinity of the remains and may or may not belong to her.

Teeth: Prominent upper teeth with visible white fillings on her front teeth; and small silver fillings in some back teeth.

Shirt: Other, T-Shirt, Blue Rodeo with thick vertical stripes in red, green and blue.
Ring: Metal, Size 9.5, Burns logo, with a red garnet and two diamonds

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2017004343.CaseDesc: Mr. Landry Ntwari travelled to Niagara Falls on January 9, 2017, for a birthday celebration. He was a registered hotel guest staying at a downtown hotel. Since January 10th, there has been no further contact or no known sighting.

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2014001474.CaseDesc: Pamela was last seen at her apartment complex on Lloyd Street in the city of Greater Sudbury, Ontario, in December of 1978.  She had left her son with her neighbour, and never returned. Her family had been expecting her to visit over the Christmas holidays, but she never went. When the family began trying to find her, they found that she had been missing for some time. She had left all her identification and personal belongings behind.

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020158.CaseDesc: This adult male was witnessed collapsing in the 400 block of Powell Street in East Vancouver. He was pronounced dead upon arrival to hospital.

Case reference: 2014006301.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2013, at 4:30, Alexis St-Denis was at his residence in Trois-Rivières. He sent a text to several people saying “Im so sorry”. Later on, a passerby found a cell phone, wallet, and headphones belonging to Alexis on the Pont de Fer bridge on the river Saint-Maurice near Highway 40. He has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2015045751.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2015 Lester Sampson was reported missing from Glen Vowell First Nation Village in B.C. This community is located on the west side of the Skeena River between Hazelton and Kispiox. Mr. Sampson’s brother last saw him at his residence in Glen Vowell on August 25, 2015.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.
